alert.note: Alert for Duplin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Duplin County, including the city of Wallace. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 649 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported many stranded vehicles in the advisory area due to thunderstorms causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wallace and Teachey. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
